results.title: The Kangaroos
results.creator_credit: David Moore and Peter Du Cane
results.brief_description: An amazingly diverse group of marsupials, the kangaroos range from small hare-wallabies and curious tree dwelling kangaroos in the Queensland rainforests, to the great Red, Euro and Grey Kangaroos of the plains, hills and forests. The behaviour of these and other kangaroos is the subject of this program.

results.title: The Kandy Perahera
results.brief_description: The Perahera that takes place in Sri Lanka, is one of the most magnificent torchlight pageants in the world. Known as the Festival of the August Moon, the Kandy Perahera is held annually in the lunar month of Esala (July/August) in the hill capital of Kandy, stronghold of the proud Sinhala Kings for over 20 centuries, and Sri Lanka’s most beautiful city. This video captures an impression of the visual splendour and exciting atmosphere of a pageant that includes up to 1200 elephants with an animated cast of thousands.

results.title: The Kamikaze of industry (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A study of Workers’ Compensation. Some migrant workers have been described as the ‘kamikaze of industry’. They have also been accused of being compo-cheats. Is the label justified?

results.title: The Kami
results.brief_description: About the vanishing art of making a water powered lathe. Its use is demonstrated by the manufacture of traditional wooden water jugs by a villager in Nepal.

results.title: The Kalahari desert people
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Dennis B. Kane, Nicholas Clapp, Robert Young and John Marshall
results.brief_description: Examines the social and cultural changes being made by the bushmen of southern Africa’s Kalahari Desert as modern influences change traditional patterns of living and they become farmer-herders after thousands of years of being hunter-gatherers.

results.title: The Just, the bad and the ugly
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Currie and Bruce Currie
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 of Bruce Currie’s dark and surrealistic experimental animations: Flank Breeder (7 mins), Anatomy of a Businessman (7 mins), One Potato Moor (6 mins) and Tar Baby (9 mins). Using the same crew and musicians (Even Orchestra), Currie digresses into dark and pessimistic urban vignettes that are anchored in base emotion: Flank Breeder shows a trapped mailbox living in the city too consumed with his tedious routine to be able to extract himself from his home to save an injured animal outside his door. Anatomy of a Businessman internalises the office politics and disillusionment. One Potato Moor finds a scarecrow (Bruce Currie) lamenting his miserable life whilst fending off a menacing pig (Paul Livingston aka Flacco) in order to survive. Life is really ugly when two men compete bitterly for the attentions of a woman in Tar Baby.

results.title: The Junk playground
results.creator_credit: Laterna Film, Kortfilmradet and Sune Lund-Sorensen
results.brief_description: A playground is an environment forming its occupants through the challenge with which it confronts them and through the chances it gives them to take up these challenges. The documentary is about a couple of junk playgrounds in or near Copenhagen.

results.title: The Jungle book: a lesson in accepting change
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Concerns the story of a young boy faced with the dilema of moving away from the place he has grown up in. Incorporates the analogy of the young boy brought up by wolves in the Jungle Book story. Interesting combination of live scenes between the boy and his uncle, indispersed with the animated sequences.

results.title: The Jungle book (plus special effects production)
results.creator_credit: Alexander Korda, United Artists Corporation and Zoltan Korda
results.brief_description: A young boy returns to his native village attempting to adapt to human customs and his adopted family. The discovery of a coin in the jungle awakens the greed of the village people who hope to discover a legendary buried treasure. Disillusioned by the greed and violence of humanity he retreats to his loyal and trusted friends … the beasts of the jungle. Stars Sabu. Based on Rudyard Kipling’s “Jungle book”. This version includes special effects techniques and production outtakes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alexander Korda, United Artists Corporation and Zoltan Korda

results.title: The Jungle Book
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions, Wolfgang Reitherman and Disney Studio Artist
results.credit_line:
Disney Studio Artist

Story Sketch

Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.material_description: Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.brief_description: Another animated classic from the Disney studios. Mowgli, the man-cub raised by wolves, must leave the jungle to take his place in the man-village. The journey is a dangerous one as Shere-Khan, the mighty tiger has sworn to kill the man-cub. Mowgli, accompanied by his loyal friends, Bagheera the panther, and Baloo, the irresponsible bear, meet an array of friends who help Mowgli escape Shere-Khan. A delightful score and voices by stars such as Phil Harris, George Sanders and Sebastion Cabot, make this a “song-filled celebration you’ll never forget.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.description:
When the jungle comes alive with rumours of the man-hating tiger Shere Khan’s return, the wise panther Bagheera knows he’ll have to get the man-cub Mowgli to safety. After being raised by wolves in the Indian jungle, Mowgli is reluctant to leave his home – despite the impending danger. Under the guidance of Bagheera and the laid-back bear Baloo, Mowgli adventures through the jungle to discover friendship, loyalty and his place in the world, while meeting a fabulous cast of friends and foes.

The Jungle Book (1967), Walt Disney Animation Studio’s classic musical adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s beloved book, has been an animated favourite for over 50 years and features the voice talents of some of the biggest stars of the day, as well as gorgeous animation, classic characters and iconic music and songs from the Sherman Brothers and Terry Gilkyson.

Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston supervised the animation for Mowgli and Baloo, who feature in the above sketch. The contrasting size and movements of the young boy and easy-going bear balance one another throughout the film. In the lively musical sequence the “Bare Necessities”, Mowgli appears clumsy and a little unsure while the wise Baloo dances gracefully to the rhythm of the accompanying jazz music, all the while showing Mowgli the ways of the jungle.
description_for_label:
